CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 19, 1954, page 8, reads: "Thousands Attend Courier Home, Food Show...12. The Seagram Distillers booth, supervised by Joe Christian, national representative, was donated tot he Pittsburgh Links. Proceeds from the sale of the Seagram's "Golden Hospitality" booklet were given to the local NAACP.  Robert French, local representative, is standing between Mrs. Mabel B. Mills who passed out goodies for Best Foods, and Mrs. Jean Farrish, who assisted in the collection of the donations For NAACP.  Seated are Mrs. Katherine Irvis and Link members Mrs. Daisy E. Lampkin and Mrs. Henry Lindsay. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait from left, seated: Katherine Irvis, Daisy E. Lampkin, Mrs. Henry Lindsay; standing: Mabel B. Mills, Robert "Bob" P. French Jr., and Jean Farrish, posed in Links Inc. and Seagram's booth with sign in back reading "Have you donated NAACP?," in Hunt Armory for 1954 Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair
CatSubject_tab: Trade shows--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair.Hunt Armory (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Lampkin, Daisy E. (Daisy Elizabeth), 1882-1965.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Farrish, Jeanne.
